text: The 2009 L'Aquila earthquake occurred on 6 April 2009 in L'Aquila, Abruzzo, Central Italy.USGS. "M6.3 â€“ central Italy". United States Geological Survey. It occurred as a result of faulting in the central Apennines. This earthquake killed over 300 people. It was Italy's most destructive of the last 30 years (as of 2009). == References == Category:2009 disasters Category:2009 in Europe Category:2000s disasters in Europe Category:2000s in Italy Category:Abruzzo Category:April 2009 events Category:Earthquakes in Italy Category:Earthquakes in the 2000s
title: 2009 L'Aquila earthquake
